notes.text: A flaw was found in gmp. An integer overflow vulnerability could allow an attacker to input an integer value leading to a crash. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: gmp: Integer overflow and resultant buffer overflow via crafted input
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Exploitation is only possible on 32-bit systems. The susceptible GMP package is not tethered to the network stack, so it can only be exploited via a file already on the local system. This can be achieved either by the attacker gaining local login credentials or alternatively; by tricking a user into loading then executing a malicious file. Because of these combined reasons Red Hat Product Security rates the impact as Moderate.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.11 see the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for this release, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this errata update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.11/release_notes/ocp-4-11-release-notes.html

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.6, see the following instructions to apply this update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.11/logging/cluster-logging-upgrading.html

vulnerabilities.title: gmp: Integer overflow and resultant buffer overflow via crafted input

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in less. The close_altfile() function in filename.c omits shell_quote calls for LESSCLOSE, a command line to invoke the optional input postprocessor. This issue could lead to an OS command injection vulnerability and arbitrary command execution on the host operating system.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: less: missing quoting of shell metacharacters in LESSCLOSE handling
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: To exploit this issue, an attacker needs the ability to influence the LESSCLOSE environment variable. This requirement makes this CVE a Moderate impact CVE.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:

vulnerabilities.title: less: missing quoting of shell metacharacters in LESSCLOSE handling

notes.text: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Curl package. This issue may lead to unintended information disclosure by the application.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl: more POST-after-PUT confusion
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

cwe.name: External Control of File Name or Path

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Curl package. This flaw allows an attacker to insert cookies into a running program using libcurl if the specific series of conditions are met.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl: cookie injection with none file
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The flaw requires a series of conditions to be met and the likeliness that they shall allow an attacker to take advantage of it is low. Even if the bug could be made to trigger, the risk that a cookie injection can be done to cause harm is additionally also low.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For OpenShift Container Platform 4.11 see the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for this release, for important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this errata update:

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.6, see the following instructions to apply this update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.11/logging/cluster-logging-upgrading.html

vulnerabilities.title: curl: cookie injection with none file

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

notes.text: A flaw was found in curl that verifies a given cookie domain against the Public Suffix List. This issue could allow a malicious HTTP server to set "super cookies" in curl that are passed back to more origins than what is otherwise allowed or possible.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: curl: information disclosure by exploiting a mixed case flaw
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: When curl is built without PSL support, it cannot protect against this problem but it is expected to not allow "too wide" cookies when PSL support is enabled.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
